title: Screenpipe
smallDesc: 24/7 local AI screen & mic recording. Build AI apps that have the full context. Works with Ollama. Alternative to Rewind.ai. Open. Secure. You own your data. Rust.
longDesc: Screenpipe is an open-source library that records your screen & mic 24/7 and connects it to LLMs. It's designed for gathering life context and easily connecting it to AI for search, automation, and more. Screenpipe captures screenshots, records audio, performs OCR, and speech-to-text. It stores data locally in a SQLite database and as mp4 files. You can then query this data through an API and pipe it into LLMs for various applications.

title: Godot Engine
smallDesc: Godot Engine is a feature-packed, cross-platform game engine to create 2D and 3D games from a unified interface.
longDesc: Godot is completely free and open source under the very permissive MIT license. No strings attached, no royalties, nothing. The users' games are theirs, down to the last line of engine code. Godot's development is fully independent and community-driven, empowering users to help shape their engine to match their expectations. It is supported by the Godot Foundation not-for-profit.Before being open sourced in February 2014, Godot had been developed by Juan Linietsky and Ariel Manzur (both still maintaining the project) for several years as an in-house engine, used to publish several work-for-hire titles.
